question: Who is Team JD coaching for?
answer: Team JD works with a wide range of clients — from complete beginners looking to build a strong fitness foundation, to experienced athletes preparing for competitive bodybuilding. Whether your goal is fat loss, muscle building, stage performance, or simply feeling your best, Jake customises everything specifically for you.

question: How does online coaching actually work?
answer: Online coaching delivers the same quality as in-person training through a dedicated coaching app. You'll receive your personalised training and nutrition program through the platform, track your progress with photos and measurements, message Jake directly at any time, and have fortnightly live video check-in calls for real-time feedback and adjustments.

question: How long does competition preparation take?
answer: Most competition preparation programs run 12–24 weeks depending on your starting point and goal federation date. Jake requires clients to have at least 1–2 years of consistent training experience before beginning a competition prep. A free consultation will help determine the right timeline for you.

question: What federations do you coach for?
answer: Jake has deep experience preparing athletes for all major Australian federations including IFBB, NABBA, INBA, ICN, FMG, and ANB. Posing and presentation are customised to the specific requirements and judging criteria of your chosen federation.

question: Do I need to be local to Melbourne for personal training?
answer: Personal training sessions are conducted in-person at a professional, fully-equipped gym in Melbourne. If you're outside Melbourne, Online Coaching offers the same level of personalised attention with the flexibility to train anywhere in the world.

question: What's included in the posing-only package?
answer: The posing package covers everything from mandatory pose mastery and your individual routine to stage presence, walk, and competition day mindset. Sessions are tailored to your specific division, federation, and physique. Whether you're a first-timer or an experienced competitor looking to refine, we'll make sure you present your best self on stage.

question: How do I get started?
answer: Book a free 15-minute consultation through Calendly. In that call, Jake will learn about your goals, assess your current situation, and determine which service is the right fit. There's no obligation — just an honest conversation about how to best help you.

question: Do I need previous experience to sign up?
answer: Not necessarily. Personal training and online coaching are available to beginners. Competition preparation does require at least 1–2 years of consistent training experience given the demands involved. Posing-only sessions are open to competitors at any experience level.
